titlepage.titleproper: A Guide to the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society Collection, 1740-1950
titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in
Special Collections 2095
titlepage.publisher: Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.physdesc: This collection consists of approximately 1,700 items, in five Hollinger boxes and one Flat box.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society Collection, Collection #2095, Special Collections, Carrier Library, James Madison University, Harrisonburg, Va.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This collection was compiled from many boxes of miscellaneous papers placed on deposit at the Library by the Harrisonburg-Rockingham Historical Society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: This collection consists of approximately 1,700 items, in five Hollinger boxes and one Flat box, and covers the dates 1740-1950. The collection is comprised of a very wide variety of legal, governmental, business, school, and church records, as well as personal papers, all primarily from the Central Shenandoah Valley (Rockingham, Shenandoah, Augusta, and Page Counties). Most are originals, but some photocopies are included.

The Legal/Governmental Documents Series includes summonses, road documents, juror lists, delivery bonds, papers from the Sheriff's Office and the Circuit Courts of Rockingham and Shenandoah Counties, CSA Telegraph Reports, postal accounts, and miscellaneous other official reports, claims, applications, etc.

The Business/Institutional Documents Series includes church histories and other church documents, school catalogs, slave purchase documents, records of Cootes' Store, and other miscellaneous business papers which are not related to families, such as the merger of the News Register Co. and Rockingham Publishing Co.

The Individual/Family Documents Series contains deeds and indentures; letters; receipts; promissory notes and other financial papers, including those related to family businesses; certificates; and miscellaneous other documents. Of particular interest are the Harrison and Lincoln folders, which include several noteworthy deeds; and the Winfield folder, which includes several items relating to the Civil War.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Documents are arranged chronologically within folders, except in the Miscellaneous folders of the Individual/Family series, where they are filed alphabetically.

did.unittitle: Account book, J. H. Shue, Clerk of Circuit Ct. 1875-1881
Articles of agreement, 1861 Militia draft substitute agreement 1821-1894
Complaints of illegal sales of poison 1906-1907
Complaints to the court. One document deals with a Negro escaping from jail 1778-1825
Court Actions: court decisions and grand jury presentments 1779-1879
Courthouse and Public Square; papers dealing with the building of a new courthouse 1832-1838
Jail: Reports on the condition of the jail 1824-1916
Juror lists. See also Oversize Series. 1871-1902, 63 items.
Lawsuit: Haga vs. Bradley. Article of agreement and depositions concerning this lawsuit. 1829-1835
Licenses: to sell merchandise, keep private entertainment, practice as physician or attorney, operate as daguerrian artist, 1929 list of stills. 1760-1929
Recognizance bonds, promises to keep the peace 1890-1897
Road documents. See also Oversize Series. 1793-1927
Tax Data. See also Oversize Series. 1801-1861
Miscellaneous legal documents: Claims, judgments of court, deposition notice, program from dedication ceremony of W.G. Myers Armory. 1797-1954
C & W Railroad Company. See also Oversize Series. 1895
Currency: Bills issued from banks and counties. 1860-1861
Gilbert, Felix. Extracts by Warren Skidmore from Account book 1768-9.
Telephone companies: Receipts from Harrisonburg Mutual Telephone Co.; by-laws of Page Co. Telephone Company. 1902-1904

General Church documents: Contains und. TM "Some Old Churches of R'ham & Neighboring Counties" by Ruebush & Wayland; M.E. Church S., R'ham Dist. Steward's Bk. 1884; 1911 R'ham Sunday Sch. Assn. Constitution; [Peaked Mtn. Church] list, 1920. 1884-1920 & und.

Church histories and directories, 1927-1950: Cook's Creek Pres. Church, 2 booklets, 1927, 1951; Hebrew Friendship congregation, booklet 1952, TM [1950?]; Methodist Church of Dayton, booklet 1951; Mt. Hebron, booklet 1950; Port Republic Methodist Church, booklet 1957; New St. Stephen's Reformed Church, booklet 1941; Trissels Mennonite Congregation, TM 1950.

School documents: Catalogs from Girls' Home School, Prospectus for Industrial School at Massanetta Springs, Program from McGaheysville H.S., Teacher's District Meeting, Timberville, 1908 program. 1889-1926
Mossy Creek Academy Lists of subscribers, Constitution (with transcription). [1850?]

Miscellaneous business documents: 1901 timber contract; 1816 & other sale notices; 1843 Elk Run tentholders agreement; subscription form, Golden Horseshoe Tavern, Elkton; 1855 R'ham Mutual Fire Ins. Co. policy for A. Sprinkel; 1913 (?) merger of News Register Co. & R'ham Pub. Co., Account with J.P. Houck; Minutebook of Weyers Cave Telephone Exchange, 1898-1952. 1816-1919
Basford, Thomas. Includes summonses, tax data, and business accounts. 1868-1874
Conrad, Edward. Contains deeds & plat for downtown Harrisonburg; other deeds; & receipt for Valley Telephone Co. shares. See also Folder Con-1 Oversize. 1895-1908
Eversole Family. Contains letters; road tax toll; RR stock receipts; & misc. 1832-1879
Garber Family. Includes tax data, muster fines, tax paper for the Confederacy, and receipts from shares of stock. 1834-1886
Gibbons Family. Contains letters written by Mary Gibbons, including 1 dated 20 Jn 1862 describing battles of Pt. Republic & Cross Keys. 1838-1895
Harrison Family. Includes an indenture that transferred land from T. Harrison to Rockingham County for a courthouse. 1779-1831
Kemper Family. Letters, mostly written to Fanny Kemper before Civil War. 1843-1862
Koontz, John. Includes 1812 grant to land where Koontz built the house later occupied by Lincolns. See also Oversize Series. 1805-1832
Lincoln Family. Includes land indentures and typescript of genealogy. See also Oversize Series. 1780-1831
Martz Family. Business letters from E. R. Shue, F. H. Bowman, etc. and letter to Hiram Martz commenting on politics and the recent elections. 1840-1914

McGahey Family. Letters, deed, survey, & appraisal of estate of Tobias R. McGahey, 1845; blacksmithing accounts; 1862 note from John Letcher; 1884 note from J.R. Jones; churn patents, & misc. 1809-1944
Nicholas Family. See also Oversize Series. 1839-1843
Roller, John Edwin. Letters; descr. of military drill; tax receipts & other business papers. 1846-1908
Showalter, Jacob. Includes 1840 indenture of John Showalter; other docs. relevant to estate of Jacob. 1826-1876
Shue, J. H. 3 Confederate bills; docs. relating to Shue estate. 1864-1886
Spader, John, and relatives. Deeds, loan bonds. 1866-1917
Winfield Family. Includes many documents relating to the Civil War, business documents, indenture for servitude of a free boy of color. 1823-1944
Assessments of clerks of the Court 1880-1914
Reports of business of the Courts 1883-1914
Miscellaneous legal documents: Juror list, list of Rockingham County officers; lists of county pensioners 1920, '21. 1874-1921
C & W Railroad Company (1 page from Bridgewater Herald Sept. 14, 1895) 1895
